text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today I am 
making a dessert that I used to be obsessed with

as a kid it's something called tao huay fruit salad 
tao huay refers to various types of milky jelly

desserts and fruit salad is fruit salad so in 
this recipe my tao huay is going to be an almond

flavored milk jelly and I used to think that 
this was a Thai dessert but turns out that the

Chinese people have it too they have this also in 
Hawaii and it's often referred to as almond float

in English it's easy and absolutely delicious 
so let's get started let's make the thahoo I

first so the gelling agent I'm using is agar 
agar which is the most common type in Thailand

I've used this many many times on the show you 
can't get this at Asian grocery stores Japanese

grocery stores will sell it under the name can 
10 health food stores will sell it also as a

vegetarian substitute for gelatin and you can 
get it online through lots of options here I'll

put the link for the online purchase in the 
description below and then all I'm gonna do

for this is I've got a pot of cold water here I'm 
gonna sprinkle my agar powder and for this recipe

I'm using powder so if you're using flakes or 
any other forms of agar agar the measurements

will not be the same just Google up sums up some 
sort of conversions I'm gonna stir that so that

all there no lumps or clumps anywhere and then 
turn on the heat this stuff always surprises me

how hot it gets now I'm gonna bring this to 
a full boil because the agar really needs a

full boil in order to completely dissolve make 
sure you stir it because otherwise it'll settle

to the bottom all right so it's come to a full 
boil careful it can boil over pretty quickly and

it's completely dissolved I'm now gonna add some 
sugar and you can add more or less sugar than me

doesn't really matter adjusted to your taste so 
when I was little we used to make this only from

a pre-mixed package and for a long time I thought 
that was the only way you could make this until of

course as a grownup I realized wait a minute that 
doesn't really save me that much time because it's

super easy to make the sugar has dissolved now 
I'm gonna add my milk so for this I'm just using

a regular 2% milk you can use almond milk or soy 
milk or any kind of white milky substance if you

would like to use for this so if you think this 
is gonna last you a while bring the milk to a

boil so it will last longer but if you're gonna 
eat in a few days we're pretty much done so I'm

gonna turn mine off and add my flavoring so I've 
got some almond extract here which you can just

get at any grocery store you don't have to do 
almond if you don't like almond in Thailand you

can get also a Jasmine flavored one it smells 
so good I'm not a fan of almond flavored things

in general but this is one exception I don't 
know what it is about this dessert so I've got

a silicone cake mold here and if you remember from 
my previous agar episode I've always had trouble

getting the agar jelly out well the trouble is no 
more if you get a silicone mold like I did here

perfect and that's it how much easier would 
a premix package be right not much so this is

now going to chill and you want this to chill 
completely before serving you want it nice and

cold from maximum refreshingness so now I'm gonna 
make the fruit salad which is more like a fruit

compote really so back in the day when I was kid 
we used to just open a can of fruit cocktail and

pour it over the jelly and that would be the end 
of it but I'm all grown up now so I'm gonna make

something a little sophisticated here I've 
got some water here I'm just gonna turn it

on and I'm making a simple syrup I'm making 
this mildly sweet here's another benefit of

making your own you can make this as sweet 
or as not sweet as you like now while that's

heating up let's look at the fruit so I've got 
my fruits separated into two bowls here and for

a good reason so this orange one here are the 
fruits that can actually go into the hot syrup

without disintegrating and I want to do that so 
that it has time to infuse its flavors into the

syrup I've got here some pineapple some Mandarin 
slices some peaches and then some mango that was

frozen so in this bowl I got my strawberries 
and my grapes and I want to leave this until

the syrup has cooled before I add them because 
otherwise the strawberries will go mushy really

quickly and the great we'll turn from green to not 
green very quickly as well I don't need to bring

this to a boil I just need it hot enough so that 
the sugar is dissolved turning that off and all

of my sturdier fruits go in without splashing hot 
syrup all over myself oh now let that sit infuse

and cool and once it's cool to room temperature 
we'll add our delicate fruits alright my throw

is now nice and cold I just pulled it from the 
fridge I'm gonna flip this whole thing out yep

oh this is always the most nerve-wracking part 
but theoretically this being silicone it should

come off very easily I just heard it go tada look 
at that perfect cube I love cubed foods there's

something about foods that are perfect squares 
that just get me so excited I'm gonna cut these

up into more perfect cubes so I'm gonna use a 
ruler to make sure that I don't mess that up

there's my beautiful fruit salad look at that 
and it's actually had a lot of time to chill

in the fridge so it's nice and cold and also you 
want to give some time for the strawberries and

the grapes that went in after to infuse their 
flavors a little bit into the syrup as well put

some cubes into my bowl here please excuse my 
hands they are keen oh look at that you get all

the different kinds of fruits in there that 
already looks refreshing you don't even have

to eat it my goodness ideally you want to use one 
of these tie spoons because holds a lot of liquid

and it's so thin that you can cut right through 
your jelly this looks so good difficult part is

deciding which fruits you want for this particular 
bite make sure you get some syrup in there oh it's

so so refreshing and bright and fruity and the 
smell of the strawberries the strawberries are

so important with this it really does or perfumes 
the whole compote in a more sort of summery way

the jelly it's just soft enough that you once you 
press down on it it just kind of falls apart in

your mouth the almond flavor mixes in with the 
fruitiness nice and close I'm telling you like

you just don't know how good this is until you 
try it it's one of the easiest easiest dessert

you can put together so I hope you give it a try 
the recipe as always would be on hot Thai kitchen

comm when you make it send me a photo I really 
want to see it it's a pretty one on Facebook

Twitter or Instagram if you haven't subscribed 
to the show make sure you do so you don't miss

an episode and when you do make sure you click 
that little bell icon so you get a notification

when I post a new video and if you love the 
show and you want to support us check out our

patreon link in the description below and I will 
see you next time for your next finishes time
